intro: Astragalus strictifolius f. grandifolius, commonly known as the large-leaved milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and pinnately compound leaves with numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense spikes, which bloom in late summer. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
